@Dan0194 wrote:

MyNameIsDylan:

I think this was a good tutorial. I don’t use PI, but this would help newbies still learning. Very nice work.

Acually he could have shown a more OOP approach of doing this and not making new methods per instance of a donor shop.

item.title: [PI] Shops - Using Donor Points [TUT]
item.dc:creator: @serversdownload serversdownload
item.description:
@serversdownload wrote:

[quote=“server2, post:22, topic:437046”][quote author=k1ng0frs link=topic=539762.msg3955169#msg3955169 date=1332688267]

src\server\model\shops\ShopAssistant.java:622: cannot find symbol symbol : variable donorPoints location: class server.model.players.Client if (c.donorPoints >= getSpecialItemValue(itemID) ) { ^ src\server\model\shops\ShopAssistant.java:624: cannot find symbol symbol : variable donorPoints location: class server.model.players.Client c.donorPoints -= getSpecialItemV alue(itemID); ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 2 errors

Here’s what i added

[code] public void handleOtherShop(int itemID) {

		if (c.myShopId == 18) {
			if (c.pcPoints >= getSpecialItemValue(itemID)) {
				if (c.getItems().freeSlots() > 0){
					c.pcPoints -= getSpecialItemValue(itemID);
					c.getItems().addItem(itemID,1);
					c.getItems().resetItems(3823);
				}
			} else {
				c.sendMessage("<col=255><shad=4000>You do not have enough PC points to buy this item.");			
			}

		}
                    if (c.myShopId == 21) {
                            if (c.donorPoints >= getSpecialItemValue(itemID)) {
                                    if (c.getItems().freeSlots() > 0){
                                            c.donorPoints -= getSpecialItemValue(itemID);
                                            c.getItems().addItem(itemID,1);
                                            c.getItems().resetItems(3823);
                                    }
                            } else {
                                    c.sendMessage("<col=255><shad=4000>You do not have enough Donor Points to buy this item.");                        
                            }
                    }[/code]

Help me please!

You Forgot to Declare the Int
[/quote]
what do you mean declare the int? im having the same problem![/quote]
same problem wth/?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Shops - Using Donor Points [TUT]
item.dc:creator: @dzeko dzeko
item.description:
@dzeko wrote:

should look like so:

public void handleOtherShop(int itemID) { if (c.myShopId == 17) { if (c.magePoints >= getSpecialItemValue(itemID)) { if (c.getItems().freeSlots() > 0){ c.magePoints -= getSpecialItemValue(itemID); c.getItems().addItem(itemID,1); c.getItems().resetItems(3823); } } else { c.sendMessage("You do not have enough points to buy this item."); } } else if (c.myShopId == 18) { if (c.pcPoints >= getSpecialItemValue(itemID)) { if (c.getItems().freeSlots() > 0){ c.pcPoints -= getSpecialItemValue(itemID); c.getItems().addItem(itemID,1); c.getItems().resetItems(3823); } } else { c.sendMessage("You do not have enough points to buy this item."); } } else if (c.myShopId == 9 || c.myShopId == 10) { if (c.donorPoints >= getSpecialItemValue(itemID)) { if (c.getItems().freeSlots() > 0){ c.donorPoints -= getSpecialItemValue(itemID); c.getItems().addItem(itemID,1); c.getItems().resetItems(3823); } } else { c.sendMessage("You do not have enough Points to buy this item."); } } }

you might have forget a bracket…

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Shops - Using Donor Points [TUT]
item.dc:creator: @dzeko dzeko
item.description:
@dzeko wrote:

[quote=“schoolrune, post:15, topic:437046”]ive done everything even add donor points liek your other tutorial EVERYthing works

But when i add my shop and set the items price (E.G 100 donor points)

it spends 100 coins and does’nt get rid of the coins i want to make it get rid of the donor points

help :)[/quote]

in ShopAssistant.java search for:

under this, you’ll see something like this:

if (c.myShopId >= XX) { handleOtherShop(itemID); return false; }
right after this add:

if (c.myShopId == XX) { handleOtherShop(itemID); return false; }
NOTE* Replace the XX by your shop Id.

Read full topic
